content.question: An ideal gas at a certain temperature is described by the Maxwell-Boltzmann velocity distribution shown in the figure. The temperature of the gas is then increased. The axes in all figures in this question have the same scales. Which of the following figures represents a possible Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution of the gas after the increase in temperature?

choices.label: The figure shows a Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution in a gridded plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Speed,” and the vertical axis is labeled “Probability Per Unit Speed.” No values are indicated on either axis. There are six evenly spaced vertical gridlines extending from the horizontal axis, and four evenly spaced horizontal gridlines extending from the vertical axis. The distribution peaks at the point with coordinates 2 units comma 4 units. The value of the distribution is nearly zero at the end of the horizontal axis.
